name: Peeper
pda_entry: A small, common herbivore. Its large eye is a curious adaptation to low light conditions.

name: Garryfish
pda_entry: A small, fast-moving fish often found in shallow waters. Known for its quick bursts of speed.

name: Bladderfish
pda_entry: Contains internal air sacs that allow it to generate drinkable water when cooked, or breathable oxygen when alive.

name: Spinefish
pda_entry: A small, bony fish with defensive spines. Offers little nutritional value.

name: Holefish
pda_entry: A small fish with a distinctive hole through its body. Edible.

name: Boomerang
pda_entry: Named for its distinctive shape, this fish is a common sight in shallow waters.

name: Eyeye
pda_entry: A small fish with a large, bioluminescent eye. Primarily found near kelp forests.

name: Hoverfish
pda_entry: A curious, docile fish that hovers in the water, making it easy to catch.

name: Gasopod
pda_entry: A passive herbivore that releases poisonous gas pods when threatened.

name: Reefback Leviathan
pda_entry: A docile, enormous leviathan-class herbivore. Its shell supports a complex ecosystem.

name: Rabbit Ray
pda_entry: A docile herbivore, easily startled, but known to approach divers out of curiosity.

name: Cuddlefish
pda_entry: An ancient, highly intelligent, and docile species with complex emotional responses. Can be befriended.

name: Jellyray
pda_entry: A large, graceful filter feeder with bioluminescent fins. Gentle and majestic.

name: Shuttlebug
pda_entry: A small, resilient filter feeder that can survive in harsh environments.

name: Skyray
pda_entry: An aerial filter feeder that glides above the water, occasionally dipping down to feed.

name: Floater (Small)
pda_entry: A symbiotic organism that attaches to objects, causing them to float. Non-aggressive.

name: Floater (Large)
pda_entry: A larger variant of the floater, responsible for the buoyancy of the Floating Island.

name: Sea Treader Leviathan
pda_entry: A massive, docile leviathan that 'treads' the seafloor, uncovering valuable resources.

name: Biter
pda_entry: A small, aggressive carnivore that attacks on sight.

name: Bleeder
pda_entry: A parasitic creature that attaches to organisms and drains blood. Dangerous in groups.

name: Stalker
pda_entry: An aggressive predator known for collecting metal salvage, possibly for its den.

name: Crabsnake
pda_entry: A highly aggressive creature that hides within Jellyshrooms, striking out at passing vehicles and divers.

name: Bone Shark
pda_entry: A heavily armored predator capable of significant damage. Attacks vehicles relentlessly.

name: Crashfish
pda_entry: A highly aggressive, territorial creature that charges intruders and explodes upon contact.

name: Cave Crawler
pda_entry: A small, scuttling arthropod that swarms perceived threats. Primarily found in caves and wreckages.

name: Ampeel
pda_entry: A large, serpentine predator that uses electrical discharges to incapacitate prey.

name: Crab Squid
pda_entry: An amphibious predator that uses EMP pulses to disable electronics before attacking.

name: Lava Larva
pda_entry: A parasitic creature that attaches to vehicles and drains their power cells.

name: Lava Lizard
pda_entry: A heat-resistant carnivore that can launch volcanic projectiles. Found exclusively in lava zones.

name: Mesmer
pda_entry: A master of hypnotic camouflage, luring prey with visual and auditory deception before attacking.

name: River Prowler
pda_entry: An agile, territorial predator found in the Lost River. Possesses powerful jaws.

name: Warper
pda_entry: An alien construct designed to contain the Kharaa bacterium. Capable of teleporting targets.

name: Reaper Leviathan
pda_entry: Apex predator. Displays extreme territoriality and will attack any perceived threat on sight. Avoid at all costs.

name: Sea Dragon Leviathan
pda_entry: Massive leviathan, capable of spitting molten rock and superheated plasma.

name: Ghost Leviathan
pda_entry: Large, translucent leviathan. Juveniles are territorial, adults patrol the ecological dead zone.
